criteria: Understanding the Intent of Rules and Laws
descriptions: No attempt to identify any rules or laws related to injury prevention.
Identifies only one rule or law, but it is vague or partially incorrect.
Identifies one rule or law accurately but provides no context or explanation.
Identifies two rules or laws accurately, providing minimal context.
Identifies three or more rules and laws accurately, providing context for at least two.
Identifies multiple rules and laws accurately, providing clear context and explaining their purpose in preventing injuries.
Shows no understanding of why rules and laws are in place to prevent injuries.
Demonstrates a limited or flawed understanding of the intent behind one rule or law.
Understands the intent of at least one rule or law, but the explanation is superficial.
Explains the intent behind two rules or laws with some clarity.
Clearly explains the intent behind multiple rules and laws and how they contribute to safety.
Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of the intent behind numerous rules and laws, explaining their societal impact on injury prevention.
Provides no relevant examples of how these rules and laws are applied.
Provides an irrelevant or incorrect example.
Provides one basic example of how a rule or law is applied.
Provides two examples of how rules or laws are applied, but lacks detail.
Gives at least three clear and relevant examples of rules and laws being applied to prevent injuries.
Offers multiple detailed and relevant examples, demonstrating a thorough understanding of how rules and laws are applied in real-world scenarios to prevent injuries.
